{"id":391470107,"question_id":99,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 years, 5 months","timestamp":1599333843,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"48 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/391470107/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"57.8 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n  void recoverTree(TreeNode *root) { \n\t\tinorder(root);\n\t\tswap(first->val, second->val);\n  }\n \nprivate:\n\tTreeNode* first;\n\tTreeNode* second;\n\tTreeNode* prev_;\n\t\n\tvoid inorder(TreeNode *root) {\n\t\tif(!root) return;\n\t\tinorder(root->left);\n\t\tif(prev_ && prev_->val > root->val) {\n\t\t\tif(!first) \n\t\t\t\tfirst = prev_;\n\t\t\tsecond = root;\n\t\t}\n\t\tprev_ = root;\n\t\tinorder(root->right);\t\n\t}\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
